courses.title: Elements of Nuclear and Radiological Engineering
courses.description: Introduction to nuclear and radiological engineering concepts and applications.

courses.title: Experimental Nuclear Reactor Physics
courses.description: Introduction to experimental nuclear reactor physics techniques including criticality, flux mapping, buckling measurements, subcritical assembly measurements, diffusion length measurement, neutron spectral measurements, and foil activation methods.

courses.title: Nuclear Radiation Detection
courses.description: An introduction to the principles and characteristics of basic detectors for nuclear radiation and the pulse processing electronics associated with them.

courses.title: Nuclear Reactor Phys I
courses.description: Intermediate treatment of reactor physics and associated advanced mathematics topics.

courses.title: Radiation Physics
courses.description: Characteristics of atomic and nuclear radiations, transition probabilities, radioactivity, classical and quantum-mechanical derivations of cross sections, interactions of photon, neutron, and charged particles with matter.

courses.title: Radiation Protection Engineering
courses.description: Covers radiation dosimetry, biological effects of radiation, radiation-protection criteria and exposure limits, external radiation protection, internal radiation protection, and sources of human exposure.

courses.title: Nuclear Reactor Theory
courses.description: Students will learn physical nuclear reactor concepts, nuclear data and computational methodology required to understand the design process of nuclear fission reactors.

courses.title: Reactor Engineering
courses.description: Nuclear heat generation; fuel elements' thermal analysis; single and two-phase flow and heat transfer in reactor systems; core thermal design and treatment of uncertainties.

courses.title: Nuclear Criticality Safety Engineering
courses.description: This course covers the theoretical concepts, the computational techniques, and the principal methods of criticality safety.

courses.title: Light Water Reactor Technology
courses.description: A systematic survey of the technology of both pressurized and boiling water reactors with emphasis on the nuclear stream supply system and its associated safety and control systems.

courses.title: Radiation Sources and Applications
courses.description: Radiation Sources. Radioisotope production. Application of radiation and radioisotope technology in industry and medicine.

courses.title: Design Methods & Tools
courses.description: Introduction to selected methods and nuclear engineering analytic tools (computer codes) with tutorials.

courses.title: Design of Nuclear and Radiological Systems
courses.description: NRE Capstone Design course - an open-minded design project, performed by students organized in design teams, that integrates all relevant nuclear and radiological engineering aspects.

courses.title: Radiological Assessment and Waste Management
courses.description: Mathematical models for movement in the environment. Scenario development for release, environmental transport, and exposure. Radioactive waste disposal facilities and waste disposal technology.

courses.title: Introduction to Radiobiology and Oncology
courses.description: This course will provide the student with a basic knowledge of radiation biology as it pertains to oncology and radiotherapy.

courses.title: Nuclear Regulatory Requirements
courses.description: This course introduces regulatory organizations and delineates their jurisdictions. It covers the fundamentals of regulations, the impacts on occupational workers, the public, and the environment.

courses.title: Introduction to Plasma Physics and Fusion Engineering
courses.description: A first course in plasma physics and magnetic confinement fusion: basic plasma physics, magnetic confinement concepts, fusion engineering, and a review of the current status of fusion research.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research Assistantship
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Undergraduate Research
courses.description: Independent research conducted under the guidance of a faculty member.

courses.title: Probabilistic Risk Assessment
courses.description: Introduction to a wide range of probabilistic risk analysis and probabilistic design methods for mechanical systems.  Topics covered are probabilistic description, sampling methods, risk assessment, and reliability-based design.

courses.title: Diagnostic Imaging Physics
courses.description: Physics and image formation methods for conventional X-ray CT, nuclear medicine, and magnetic resonance and ultrasound imaging.

courses.title: Nuclear Chemical Engineering
courses.description: This course surveys the chemical engineering aspects of nuclear power.  Topics include nuclear reactions, fuel cycles, solvent extraction of metals, the properties of actinides and other irradiated fuel materials, fuel reprocessing, and radioactive waste management. Crosslisted with CHBEÂ 4770.

courses.title: Fundamental Elements of Nuclear Reactor Materials
courses.description: Introduction to fundamentals of nuclear reactor materials.  Topics covered are basics of radiation damage, defect creation and evolution, microstructure-property correlations in cladding and fuel of nuclear materials.

courses.title: Transport Fundamentals
courses.description: Neutral and charged particle transport. Fluid mass, energy, and momentum transport. Models used in nuclear radiation transport; fluid hydrodynamics, radiative and plasma transport.

courses.title: Plasma Physics
courses.description: Physics of ionized plasmas. Magnetic confinement, kinetic and fluid theories, equilibrium, waves and stability, plasma-material interactions, atomic/molecular-plasma interactions, multispecies transport. Plasma processing applications.

courses.title: Computational Methods of Radiation Transport
courses.description: Deterministic and stochastic computational methods for solving transport equations of neutral particles.

courses.title: Reactor Physics
courses.description: Fundamentals of reactor physics for nuclear analysis of neutron chain reactors and for developing tools required for design of those reactors.

courses.title: Reactor Engineering
courses.description: Two-phase flow, boiling heat transfer, fast reactor thermal-hydraulics, reactor thermal-hydraulics uncertainty analysis, loss-of-coolant accidents. Reactor thermal- hydraulic accident analysis.

courses.title: Advanced Nuclear Engineering Design
courses.description: Synthesis of principles of nuclear engineering in the design of nuclear reactors and other facilities.

courses.title: Nuclear Criticality Safety Engineering
courses.description: Concepts, computational techniques, and the principal methods of criticality safety such as accident experience, standards, experiments, computer and hand calculations, limits and regulations. Application to overall facility operation.

courses.title: Nuclear Fuel Cycle
courses.description: Fission fuel cycle, uranium mining and milling, enrichment. Fuel fabrication. In-core fuel management. Reprocessing and fuel cycle economics. Spent-fuel waste management.

courses.title: Nuclear Materials
courses.description: Materials science and engineering of metallic and ceramic fuels; cladding, structural, and control materials including radiation effects.

courses.title: Management of the Nuclear Enterprise
courses.description: Identify and understand the unique challenges of and techniques for managing highly technical, potentially hazardous operations, issues within the nuclear industry.

courses.title: Fundamentals of Nuclear Nonproliferation
courses.description: This course explores the fundamentals of nuclear energy generation, pathways of materials misuse, the implication of nuclear technology for international security and policy.

courses.title: Seminar: Politics Tech & Proliferation
courses.description:
This seminar course is designed specifically to encourage new thinking and creative effort on nuclear deterrence and strategic 
stability for our global future.

courses.title: Radiological Assessment and Waste Management
courses.description: Critical analyses of sources and human exposures, mathematical models for movement through the biosphere, environmental transport, and exposure for nuclear facilities and waste disposal processing. Crosslisted with HP 6755.

courses.title: Radiation Physics
courses.description: Characteristics of atomic and nuclear radiation, transition probabilities, radioactivity and isotopes, cross sections, electromagnetic radiation, neutrons, and charged particle interaction with matter. Crosslisted with HP 6756.

courses.title: Radiation Detection
courses.description: Introduction to the theory and application of radiation detectors, measurement methods, signal processing, and data analysis. Crosslisted with HP 6757.

courses.title: Numerical Methods in Mechanical Engineering
courses.description: Numerical methods for solution of engineering problems; initial, eigenvalue, and boundary-value problems; computational stability for ordinary and linear partial differential equations.  Crosslisted with ME and HP 6758.

courses.title: Radiation Shielding Principles and Analysis
courses.description: Principles of Radiation Shielding; Design of Shields; Computational Methods for Analysis of Shielding; Emphasis on Monte Carlo Simulation as a Shielding Tool.

courses.title: Advanced Plasma Physics
courses.description: Classical and collective transport phenomena, plasma instabilities, plasma-materials interactions, and plasma edge physics. Emphasis on magnetic fusion, plasma processing, and other plasma applications research.

courses.title: Advanced Reactor Physics
courses.description: Advanced topics in reactor physics and transport theory.

courses.title: Teaching Practicum
courses.description: Supervised teaching for doctoral students.  Teaching techniques, course and curriculum design, student evaluation methods and criteria. Students may, in some instances, prepare and present lectures.  Crosslisted with HP, ME, and CHBEÂ 7757.
